javaslang.control

Class Match<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaslang.control.Match<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The result type of the Match expression.

    public final class Match<R>
extends Object
    A better switch for Java. A Match...
    • has a fluent API and is an expression
    • is able to match types, i.e. Match.caze((byte b) -> "a byte: " + b)
    • is able to match values, i.e. Match.caze(BigDecimal.ZERO, b -> "Zero: " + b)
    Example of a Match as partial function: 
     final Match<Number> toNumber = new Match.Builder<Number>()
     .caze((Integer i) -> i)
     .caze((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
     .build();
 final Number number = toNumber.apply(1.0d); // throws a MatchError
    Example of a Match as total function: 
     Match
     .<Number> caze((Integer i) -> i)
     .caze((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
     .orElse(() -> -1)
     .apply(1.0d); // result: -1

    The following calls are equivalent:

    • new Match.Builder<R>.caze(...).build().apply(obj)
    • new Match.Builder<R>.caze(...).apply(obj)
    • Match.caze(...).apply(obj)
    Since:
    1.0.0

      A Match builder, providing fluent API to specify Match cases.

      A function f: long -&gt; R that takes a primitive long value and returns a value of type R.
      static class  Match.MatchBuilder<R>
      An abstract Match builder providing base methods for the internal Match builder DSL.
      static class  Match.OrElseBuilder<R>
      An abstract Match builder providing the orElse case.
      static interface  Match.ShortFunction<R>
      A function f: short -&gt; R that takes a primitive short value and returns a value of type R.

      • apply

        public R apply(Object obj)
        Applies an object to this matcher. This is the implementation of the Function1 interface.
        Parameters:
        obj - An object.
        Returns:
        The result when applying the given obj to the first matching case. If the case has a consumer, the result is null, otherwise the result of the underlying function or supplier.
        Throws:
        MatchError - if no Match case matches the given object and no default is defined via orElse().
        Failure.NonFatal - if an error occurs executing the matched case.
